channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Klarna Takes on Amex Platinum and Chase Sapphire with Premium Perks That Don’t Require a Credit Card
item.description: The Swedish fintech’s new tiers offer luxury travel perks, lounge access, cash back, and subscriptions as more Americans shift toward BNPL.

item.title: Bob Iger says Disney’s $1 billion deal with OpenAI is an ‘opportunity, not a threat’: ‘We’d rather participate than be disrupted by it’
item.description: The three-year deal will bring more than 200 Disney characters to Sora.

item.title: Stop Treating Nonprofits as Charities
item.description: The nonprofit crisis is a call to start funding them as essential infrastructure.

item.title: ‘Architects of AI’ named Time’s 2025 Person of the Year
item.description: The “Architects of AI ” were named Time’s person of the year Thursday, with the magazine citing 2025 as when the potential of artificial intelligence ...

item.title: ‘Creativity is the new productivity’: Bob Iger on why Disney chose to be ‘aggressive,’ adding OpenAI as a $1 billion partner
item.description: "We'd rather participate in the rather dramatic growth, rather than just watching it happen and essentially being disrupted by it," Iger told CNBC.

item.title: Trump’s $100,000 fee on H-1B visas is backfiring—and shutting out foreign workers
item.description: This fall, President Trump took aim at the H-1B visa, in a move that has been telegraphed for years amid criticism that the program diverts jobs away ...

item.title: BTC price: Why is Bitcoin, XRP, and other crypto down on Fed rate cut when the stock market is up?
item.description: As we enter the 2025 home stretch, Bitcoin is once again down, dipping below $90,000 on Thursday, following the Federal Reserve’s highly anticipated i...

item.title: A Baby Was Born in a San Francisco Waymo—and It Wasn’t Even the First
item.description: An expecting mother gave birth in a Waymo this week on the way to a San Francisco hospital in a rare, but not unprecedented, event.

item.title: OpenAI and Disney just ended the ‘war’ between AI and Hollywood with their $1 billion Sora deal—and OpenAI made itself ‘indispensable,’ expert says
item.description: “Google has YouTube. OpenAI now has the Magic Kingdom,” copyright expert Matthew Sag said.

item.title: GM Flubbed a Recall, Now It’s Facing a Massive Lawsuit
item.description: The company’s fix allegedly didn’t solve the problem, and customers are not happy.

item.title: OpenAI aims to silence concerns it is falling behind in the AI race with release of new model GPT-5.2
item.description: OpenAI said its new model outperforms those from rivals Google and Anthropic across a wide range of evaluations.

item.title: RFK Jr. and Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy had a pull-up competition at Reagan to announce Trump’s $1 billion plan for healthy airport upgrades
item.description: Officials were vague about what these upgrades could include.

item.title: How Much Water Does AI Actually Use? Depends Who You Ask.
item.description: Every time ChatGPT is tasked to write an essay or Claude is asked for help with vibe coding, water is being used. How much exactly?

item.title: The Disney-OpenAI tie-up has huge implications for intellectual property
item.description: Walt Disney and OpenAI make for very odd bedfellows: The former is one of the most-recognized brands among children under the age of 18. The near-$200...

item.title: The case only Netflix can make for buying Warner Brothers Discovery
item.description: The battle for Warner Brothers Discovery got hotter this week as Paramount launched a hostile bid of $108.4 billion for the company, topping Netflix’s...
